concept.name: print
concept.description:
We use the print() function to output data to the standard output device (screen). It is also possible to output data to a file.

Sometimes we would like to format our output to make it look attractive. This can be done by using the str.format() method. This method is visible to any string object.
concept.code:
print('This sentence is output to the screen')
a = 5 print('The value of a is', a)
print(1, 2, 3, 4) print(1, 2, 3, 4, sep='*') print(1, 2, 3, 4, sep='#', end='&')
x = 5; y = 10 print('The value of x is {} and y is {}'.format(x,y)) # output: The value of x is 5 and y is 10
print('I love {0} and {1}'.format('bread','butter')) print('I love {1} and {0}'.format('bread','butter'))
